metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3583 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The handle_headers function in mod_proxy_fcgi.c in the mod_proxy_fcgi module in the Apache HTTP Server 2.4.10 allows remote FastCGI servers to cause a denial of service (buffer over-read and daemon crash) via long response headers.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3583` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-macro - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
libapache2-mod-proxy-html - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
No subscription required

apache2 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-data - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-mpm-event - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-mpm-itk - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-mpm-prefork - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-mpm-worker - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-suexec - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-utils - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
apache2.2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1').
